metadata.name: Potential PHP Reverse Shell
metadata.comment: Detects usage of the PHP CLI with the "-r" flag which allows it to run inline PHP code. The rule looks for calls to the "fsockopen" function which allows the creation of sockets. Attackers often leverage this in combination with functions such as "exec" or "fopen" to initiate a reverse shell connection.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND contains(lower(process.name), lower('/php')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -r ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('fsockopen')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('ash')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('bash')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('bsh')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('csh')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('ksh')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('pdksh')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('sh')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('tcsh')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('zsh'))))
